ac:rich-text-body.p: Purpose: Comprehensive evaluation of API Gateway solutions for enterprise deployment on AWS EKS
Scope: 8 candidates evaluated across 30 requirement categories
Note: Scores calculated across all 88 requirement criteria. Maximum possible score: 440 (88 x 5)

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: Best for AWS + EKS Native Deployment

ul.li: Native Kubernetes CRDs and Ingress Controller
Excellent Helm chart with production-ready defaults
Hot reload without downtime via etcd/Admin API
80+ built-in plugins covering all requirements

ac:rich-text-body.p: Runner-up: Kong Gateway (more mature enterprise ecosystem, higher cost for enterprise features)

ul.li: Native Spring Security with OIDC/SAML support
Deep Java ecosystem integration (familiar to enterprise teams)
Excellent for complex authorization logic
Best choice if team has strong Java/Spring expertise

ac:rich-text-body.p: Runner-up: Kong Enterprise (dedicated OIDC plugin, 24/7 support)

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: Best for High Throughput / Low Latency

ul.li: NGINX + LuaJIT core delivers sub-millisecond latency overhead
Benchmarks show 10x+ performance vs Java-based gateways
Excellent connection pooling and HTTP/2/3 support

ac:rich-text-body.p: Runner-up: Envoy Gateway (proven at Google/Lyft scale, slightly higher complexity)

ul.li: 24/7 enterprise support with SLAs
Most extensive documentation and training resources
Proven track record at Fortune 500 companies
Enterprise dashboard with RBAC

ac:rich-text-body.p: Runner-up: AWS API Gateway (fully managed, zero infrastructure, but limited customization)

p.strong: NGINX + Node.js Custom Gateway: NOT RECOMMENDED

ac:rich-text-body.p: Building a custom gateway requires significant ongoing investment with limited return.

ul.li: Security debt: CVEs require custom patching
Bus factor: Original developers leave, knowledge is lost
Feature lag: Always catching up to industry standards
Testing burden: Must validate every edge case yourself
Compliance: Self-attestation for SOC2/PCI audits
Best overall balance of features, performance, and operational simplicity
Native Kubernetes support with mature CRDs
80+ built-in plugins covering all requirements
Lua scripting for custom logic without recompilation
Active Apache Foundation governance
Zero license cost, enterprise support available
Most mature enterprise API gateway ecosystem
Extensive enterprise support options with SLAs
Largest plugin marketplace
Proven at Fortune 500 scale
Best choice if enterprise support contract is mandatory

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: Alternative for Java Teams: Spring Cloud Gateway

ul.li: Best choice if team has strong Java/Spring expertise
Native Spring Security for enterprise auth integration
Excellent for existing Spring Boot microservices ecosystems
Consider if maintaining single-language stack is a priority

ac:rich-text-body.p: This section maps the existing Barclays Live Proxy authentication and routing flow requirements to API Gateway candidates. Requirements extracted from BCLCORESRV-6305 sequence diagram and Proxy Criteria documentation.

td.p: ENT-04: HTTP Method Allow/Deny per Route
QTA-01: Max Thread Limits per CP

ul.li: Best overall fit for Barclays Live Proxy requirements
Excellent Lua plugin system for custom EntitlementManager integration
Native support for dynamic upstream selection (CP Server routing)
Built-in support for SSO redirect flows and session management
Superior connection pooling and timeout configuration per route
Mature plugin ecosystem for custom authentication flows
Enterprise support available for mission-critical deployments
Strong header/cookie manipulation capabilities
Consider if enterprise support contract is mandatory

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: BL Proxy Java Option: Spring Cloud Gateway

ul.li: Best Kerberos support via Spring Security
Native Java integration with existing BL services
Easiest migration path from current Java-based proxy
WebFlux provides excellent reactive streaming support (Flux)

p.strong: AWS API Gateway: NOT RECOMMENDED for BL Proxy (71%)

ac:rich-text-body.p: Key gaps: Limited Kerberos support, inflexible session management, 29-second timeout limit incompatible with long-running requests, limited custom authentication flows.

p.em: Document Version: 1.1 | Generated: January 2026 | Review Schedule: Quarterly
